Reviews.Title: Good spycam floodlight
Reviews.Author: Debbi's
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with this product and the price.  I set the camera, lights, and audio to turn on/record when motion was detected except for daytime when I set it for only the camera and audio to turn on/record. It's really nice having the options of the different settings.  It was relatively easy to assemble, program, and install.  Considering I'm a 50-year old mother of three, I had no difficulty installing it in place of the flood light over our garage.  I like the way you can position the lights and the motion sensor/camera to just about any position you want.  It was also easy to remove the memory card, an allen wrench is supplied to open and close the cover, and of course a ladder was necessary since I installed it above the garage.  The videos were crystal clear when I viewed them on the computer.  I don't know yet if the memory card (2gb) that comes with it will have sufficient space, but so far so good.

When they find unlocked cars, they grab anything of value. Our car was broken into last year, which spurred the purchase of this item. I purchased this camera/light to get them on video for the cops. However, the video is not very good quality at night, and there is bad interference from the lights which made them unrecognizable from just 23 feet away!The other down side to this camera is that you cannot select the camera to work only at night. It is possible that burglar footage has been lost due to this feature.I am including pictures and videos of the referenced video so you can see how poor of a job this camera really does!

Reviews.Title: SmartGuard + Eye-Fi
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: Just installed my SmartGuard E120CA-1. All seems to be well, with so-so instructions. But things are so simple you really don't need much of that.The problem lies here: It's a hassile every time you need to view the content on the SD card, you need to grab that funky wrench, open the access panel, remove the SD card and bring it to your computer to see the video clips. SO, I tried to be smart and stick an Eye-Fi card (Connect X2 4GB) in there, thinking I can retrive all the captured video wirelessly, and therefore no more disassembly before viewing any video. Well, it did not work. This camera is recording in ASF format, and seems like Eye-Fi is not supporting it. I understand this is not a problem from the SmartGuard itself, but are there anyone out there that have experience in dealing with this and willing to help?Many thanks in advance.

Reviews.Title: Smartguard Security Lighting Camera
Reviews.Author: Eagle Eye "Bill"
Reviews.Content: Wow, I don't believe how good this product has been for the price.  It came about a week ago and I installed it right away.  For the price, you can't beat it.  It cost about twice as much as a motion light without a camera.  The pictures are very good and the light comes on at night when there is a motion too.It was just a little confusing to set it up, but not too bad.  The mounting plate wouldn't fit my existing junction box.  All I needed to do is cut some of the plastic away from the mounting holes and that problem was solved.  I have tried single shot, burst and video.  I can't decide between the burst and the video, both are good.  I downloaded the pictures directly from the camera onto my laptop with the provided cable.  It couldn't have been easier.  I didn't want to remove the SD card because the instructions said I had to shut off the power to do so.  Shutting off the power means that you have to reset the date, time etc...  I put in a new 1GB SD card that I had which may fill up in 2 weeks with all the times somebody walks by it.No problem with that, it should just put the new pictures in the spots where the oldest ones were.  If there was a burglary we would check the card before the pictures or videos were replaced.  A note about SD cards, they are now selling a lot of SDHC card.  They don't work in many products that require SD only.  I am not sure if that is the case with the Smartguard Security Lighting Camera, just use a regular SD to be sure.

Reviews.Title: Expensive Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Marlene G
Reviews.Content: My advice is Do Not Buy this light.  It worked OK for 4 months and then stopped altogether.  When I contacted the seller, I was told that they only guaranteed it for 30 days but I could contact the manufacturer.  After emailing the manufacturer and asking  if I could perhaps buy the defective part, he said that he would send me a new one immediately.  That was a month ago and nothing. This item is much too expensive to take the chance that you won't get a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Excellent lights and camera
Reviews.Author: WK
Reviews.Content: Good variety of settings.  Takes great pictures.  If you put in the batteries it will even take pictures when the power is out.  If you do, check on them regularly.  When I last changed them, one was beginning to leak but fortunately not enough to do any damage.  Glad I didn't wait any longer.  Has an audible alarm that you can cut on and off to match your preferences.  Seems to be strong and well made.  One shortcoming is that you have to remove the fixture to change the batteries.  Some of the documentation says to leave the batteries out, but they seem to be OK if you check on them occasionally.

Reviews.Title: cheap quality
Reviews.Author: willie haley
Reviews.Content: first of all the camera didn't work and the alarm was not loud enough, the motion didn't pick up out side of 15 feet...i would spend more $ to get a better quality but i am still looking for one like this that records and have a louder alarm.

Reviews.Title: It was nice while it lasted (about 3 months)
Reviews.Author: RisingPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I bought this after buying a different one from the same company that had failed (the 300 Watt version).This one failed, too. It just took longer (but not long enough). 3 month lifespan for this? Seriously? What is up with all these companies who can't make electronics. This is not a complicated device.It worked fine at first. I only ever removed the SD card a few times over the lifespan to view videos. The last time I had checked it, I noticed that some of the video recordings were corrupted, and figured its time was near. I was right. Next time I had checked for videos, nothing had been recorded.Buy this product if you want a $160 motion light in a few months, because the camera portion is certainly shaky at best.

Reviews.Title: I caught him in the act
Reviews.Author: Geoffre
Reviews.Content: Read the directions carefully twice before you program itI got absolutly amazing video of an intruder I was trying to catch on my propertyThere was no denying it  I showed the video to my neighbors, now that guy isn't welcome anywhere in our townGeoffrey

Reviews.Title: Not recording Data after 6 months of use
Reviews.Author: J. Roch
Reviews.Content: Instructions are very sketchy. Device will not reset to obtain or get it to record. There is no customer service phone number for support. Waiting for an e-mail.

Reviews.Title: Fair
Reviews.Author: J. Tryner
Reviews.Content: The motion sensor does not always work, and many times the lights do not come on until 5 to 10 seconds after someone has left the area.  The camera takes OK video.  It is important to note that this takes audio also.  That is a felony here in IL, and I had to partiallly disassemble the until to clip off the wires to the microphone.  This is a potentially very serious matter, and potential buyers need to be aware of the wiretapping statute for their state.

Reviews.Title: Great item for price and usefulness!!!
Reviews.Author: cj92063
Reviews.Content: Great item for price and usefulness! Very easy to install programing a little tricky you should read and follow paper work that comes with product.

Reviews.Title: Great floodlight & camera for home use
Reviews.Author: Bob Miller
Reviews.Content: We had a rash of neighborhood robberies - the thieves were stealing contents from cars parked in the home owners driveway.  So, I bought one of these and installed it where I had an ordinary spotlight that was not motion activated.  It did the trick!  Within a few weeks I was able to play the recording and see that someone had walked down my driveway in the middle of the night to attempt to break into my vehicle.  The motion activated light and camera turned on and you saw the person make a hasty retreat!

Reviews.Title: Good product, good price
Reviews.Author: jc2010
Reviews.Content: I purchased this security camera because of Debbie Chapman's review above.  She is right about the video being crystal clear.  We installed it at our carwash and you can even see the license plate numbers on the cars.  Plus, the price on amazon is very affordable compared to other websites. Very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the money
Reviews.Author: David H.
Reviews.Content: The field of motion could be better, but the distance it picks up motion is great. My favorite thing about this is that it actually starts recording to the SD card a few seconds before actual motion is detected so you get to "see" what was happening just before motion is detected. I've tried several of these "self-contained" systems and this one works the best. If this had a wider field of detection, I'd have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working within a few months.
Reviews.Author: Brocko
Reviews.Content: Requires batteries for the motion sensor and they go dead quickly.  After 2-3 months of owning it, the batteries died for the second time and since then, it has not worked.  The little LCD readout works for about a minute with new batteries, but the light doesn't work.  This is expensive junk.

Reviews.Title: It Works!
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: It's somewhat difficult to set up and the programming is not clear.  It does not always come on and record.  Sometimes when the camera is recording at night, the light does not come on so it picks up a dark screen without being able to see action.  I wouldn't put it in a location that's important.  Also, the SD card cover is not easy to remove.  It uses an unusual wrench for the screw.  If you lose the wrench, you will have to search for a compatible replacement.  Essentially, they need to make it more user friendly and sync the light/camera operation.

Reviews.Title: Lights are not bright enough
Reviews.Author: No Name
Reviews.Content: Do not purchase this product!!  The lights are only 60 watts each and do not project enough light to clearly capture video at night.

Reviews.Title: Security Solution from Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Laurlie P
Reviews.Content: The SmartGuard 4 in 1 motion activated light and camera with SD card ordered from Amazon works well for our application and covers our total back yard.  The pictures taken by this unit are reasonably clear and would enable us to identify an intruder if there was a security problem.  The only drawback to this unit is that you have to partially remove the unit to access the memory card.  Other then this drawback, I would recommend this unit to anyone needing an inexpensive solution to provide security to a portion of their property.

Reviews.Title: failed before I could return
Reviews.Author: R. Richards
Reviews.Content: Item was junk.Turned it over to my tech for troubleshooting. Discovered that it was wired wrong from the start and burnt the board. The only thing left was camera and motion sensor.I didn't even try to return it. I paid a very high price for a camera and SD card.I am going to make a homemade camera out of it.Don't buy anything from these guys. The bad reviews are piling up and for good reason.

Reviews.Title: SmartGuard 120W 4-in-1 motion activated light+camera
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised. Illumination is sufficient though a little more wattage might be better.Camera is impressive. Mounts easily. Some people may need to make some alterations as I did since the base diameter is a little large. The batteries may require a little work to replace since the base is flush to the electrical box you mount it to. Mounting the unit obviously requires it to be at least 8-10 feet above the ground to prevent tampering. Not American-made. Is anything ever made here?

Reviews.Title: Great Security/Camera/Light
Reviews.Author: BenK
Reviews.Content: It is a easy to install and figure out security light/Camera. Can adjust the setting for high resolution or low video. In high the 1 GB SD card is only enough for 1 day worth of video though!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Darrell Kneice
Reviews.Content: Works just as stated !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I recomend this as a device to buy. One thing though ; You must buy a scandisk reader if you don't already have one. Without the Disk Reader you cannot view your vide. I wish they would have told me this. I did take care of it by going back and buying the disk reader. $12 bucks...

Reviews.Title: A MUST HAVE
Reviews.Author: Bkind
Reviews.Content: This is a must have for home security.  It takes pictures day n night. There are several settings for when the lights come on, how long they stay on, n sensitivity to movement. This is my 3rd SmartGuard in 8 years. I don't use the audio warnings.  I love that this system runs on backup battery if the power goes out.  This new camera uses up to 32G SD card.  The old cameras only store 2G.  They hold up to outside conditions very well.

Reviews.Title: Good video
Reviews.Author: John Williamson
Reviews.Content: This product works as described and would have given it a full 5 stars if access to the sd card was easy. Very hard to access with the camera under an eave.

Reviews.Title: good light
Reviews.Author: Tony H. Dupree "The Kid"
Reviews.Content: light very nice and bright, and the recording is great as well as the alarms the only draw back is you dont want to place it way up in the air unless you have a 32 or 64 card and dont need to check it every 7-10 days. over all i really like this light very sturdy and well built

Reviews.Title: a clear bust
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: waited over a year to install it. Does the barking noise which is faint, lights won't come on.  Lost a lot of money on this fail.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: Timothy P.
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, I am still trying to figure it out. I have it in my backyard. I can't figure out how to turn the camera off when i am in the backyard.

Reviews.Title: don't buy this item!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: hibri2000
Reviews.Content: I bought this item for a costumer of mine and once I installed it and found it to be defective the company Smart Gaurdian refused to return my calls and emails. If you buy it you are screwed.

Reviews.Title: Motion Activated Light
Reviews.Author: "Pepin"
Reviews.Content: Lights quit working after i received it. I did not bother to contact seller. I still have it in is box, maybe i just received a bad one. who knows, never tested the camera, maybe it works.

Reviews.Title: Smartguard  120w 4 in 1 security system
Reviews.Author: Roger D. Glymph
Reviews.Content: Hello:This little device is very effective for the purposes needed by me.  I had a bugler trolling through my carport in the early morning hours recently.  My pick-up truck was not locked and the vandal ransacked the center console and other compartments in the truck.  Fortunately,  I did not leave any item of major value in the truck and it was not damaged.  I felt so vulnerable that I searched the internet and found this security device.  I installed the device and placed it on a digital electric timer and set it to activate from 12a.m. to 6a.m. nightly.  The system operates in the default mode when the timer powers it up. And fortunately, these default setting perform all the major functions desired by me.  After an initial warm-up period when powered up by the timer, the system is armed to light up, sound an alarm, and do video surveillance when the motion detector is set off.  I didn't need to use any back-up batteries and I can disarm or activate the system at any time by manually switching the electric timer on or off.  And if I need to be in the carport after 12a.m. then I simply shut off the power to the system temporarily and then reactivate it again from the timer located securely in my covered garage next to the carport monitoring area.  I can do multiple settings of my timer during the week and on week-ends as needed.
